column4: hi, does anyone know when the wine 0.9.60 package is available through the package manager? And also, how I can install wine's own ubuntu-.deb without causing problems later on?
easiest thing to do is just add the wine repository
then you can just use synaptic to install it
yeah, but when the repos don't update fast enough, I'd like to do it myself...
if you add the wine repository, it should update when wine updates their repository
i just double checked, i'm using 0.9.6
hmm, then why haven't I got it yet? o_O
how did you install it?
FROM THE WINE REPO or from the ubuntu repo, pay atttention
I have the wine one added to my repo list, at least
i don't know.. cuz i'm on the current one, and i didn't do anything.. and its the one i have
have you upgraded to hardy?
didn't upgrade, i clean installed, but i've used wine for a while, and i've always gotten regular updates via the wine repo
yeah, but when I checked the wine page they only mention the hardy repo, nada about gutsy
well, i don't know about that, but i did notice that.. maybe they arent supporting old repos anymore.. don't know.. but i noticed that also.
checking on the #winehq now
hmm, my wine pck is held back from upgrading oO
only prob would be that windows won't see it anymore.
who cares about windows? /me is ubuntu only ;)
then format away, shouldn't be an issue.. all mine are ext3
good stuff! /me starts formatting and jumps to bed
have fun
